Kapsel is drinking an Oude Lambiek by Geuzestekerij De Cam

2017 dzikie, wiejskie klimaty, nie jest jakieś bardzo kwaśne, fajne pijalne.

Rami Rami is drinking an Oude Lambiek by Geuzestekerij De Cam at Wał Gocławski

2017. Zaje profil dzikusow. Owocowosc tez. W smaku taki ostry, agresywny. Jakby alkoholowy? Moze slodkawy? Aromat 4.3, smak 3.5

Dégustation Manseau printemps 2017. Bouteille 2000-2005. Une robe jaune sans mousse, rien de surpreant. Un nez de pain de mie, de fromage ou autre pourriture avec du vomi et du moisi. Une bouche fort agréable avec des notes de fromages (moissisure) ronde et sans acidité. Franchement succulente.

Bouteille 750ml, étiquette 2000-2005. Couleur jaune-orangée pâle voilée, aucune mousse. Arôme de fromage, levures sauvages, humidité, floral. Goût de levures sauvages, fruité, acidité moyenne-faible. Aucune carbonatation,​ corps moyen.

Bouteille datée dau moins 12 ans. Robe jaunâtre tirant sur lorangée avec de minuscules particules en suspension et sans col de mousse. Arômes de bois, pelures de pommes, citron. En bouche, pomme verte, citron, lambics boisés, yogourt âcre, herbes séchées, eau minérale. Texture aqueuse et corps mince.

Pours a clear straw to light copper colour with no head. Funky aroma with lemons, cheese, light barnyard. The taste is barnyardy, stone fruits, light mineral peach, dry brett, mineral and stoney, flinty. Aftertaste is dry, funky acidic. Mouthfeel is light to medium with a very light fizz.
Aroma: paardendeken en urine. Zeer droog mondgevoel, droog, gortdroog, fijn tonggevoel. Cirtrus, gras, kruiden. Heerlijk. De smaak openbaart zich na een paar slokken. Heerlijk.

Bottle. Vintage 2012. Golden, slightly hazy with no head. Nice barnyard and horse blanket aromas, leathery just a slightly acidic. Light to medium sourness, light herbal bitterness. Light body, watery texture, no carbonation. Dry, tart, woody. In overall nice and delicate brew.

Sweet white grape aroma, sour and with a little vinegar. Cranberry and white wine accents. Almost clear gold under thin white wisps. Very sour flavour that develops into white wine, a little oaky vinegar, and a clean finish. Medium light body, mouth puckering, at first, moderate carbonation.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Almost clear pale orange pour with little to no head. The aroma is quite similar to the De Cam Oude Geuze - peaches, minerals, barnyard funk, light apple cider and overripe apples. Very low carbonation, but still present, medium to light sour and light bitter. Quite enjoyable.
0,75l fles gedeeld bij lion. Amber met een witte kraag. Aardbei perzik en volkoren brood. Zuur is goed in balans klein zitje in de afdronk. Nais
Copper body with minimal head. Aroma has lemon, brandy, wet hay. Light body with minimal carbonation. Flavour has notes of green apple, lemon.

375mL 2000 bottle at Akkurat, 11/28/16.Clear, bright, peachy-tinged golden; soft, warm hues and just a touch of carbonation from its long captivity in bottle.Nectarine, lemon, cheese rind, light vanilla and touches of dusty, earthy malt all provide a charmingly funky but "clean" nose for such an old, small bottle. No oxidation whatsoever, or at least not manifesting itself negatively here. Funky, bright brett with soft tropical fruit suggestions and lots of lactic acid lingering on the end.In the mouth its still, of course, but with just a touch of frizzante-like charm. Meyer lemon and hints of honey soften the hard lactic bite. The wateriness inherent in a still beverage spreads out the sourness instead of concentrating it, thanks to the ultra-dry body; though make no mistake, this is not thin. The end result is a phenomenally drinkable, quenching, simple drink, with moderate funk and a pleasing sour bite on the end. This is exactly what I envision when I think of unblended lambics. If I had to drink a 3 Liter of beer to myself, this is pretty damned near close to what Id choose.

75cl bottle @Irreale, Madrid. 13-04-2015.
Bottled: Jan 2009.
Pours very hazy orange with frothy white head. Short head retention, soog lacing. Horseblanket, grapy, lactic nose. Light body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is dry, quite sour, fruity. Very enjoyable.
Bottle: Poured a hazy orange with no head. Danky dusty barn dirt. Taste is dry funky.
Bottle shared by a friend. Pours clear amber with a thin white head. Aroma of lemon chiffon, malt and funk. Malty flavor with sour lemon before a bitter grass and oak finish.

Shared 75cl bottle at Olut (Sabadell). The best smelling lambic Ive tasted ever, only slightly acid, a bit of fruit sweetness as in some dessert white wines but with dry ending. Ik hou van belgische bier!!!
At kermis. Bottle shared courtesy of kermis. Clear orange with no head. Sweet grain, hay, horse, wood, funk. Light sweet and sour. Medium body, good as no carbonation.

Bottle shared. Pours a crystal clear orange golden with no head or carbonation. Aroma is nice and dry fruitiness with a good amount of funk. Taste is very smooth and balanced with fruit and funk in harmony.
Shared bottle. Pours a clear yellowish-orange. Non-existent head. Aroma is fruity, white wine. Taste is similar to nose, with some funky elements. Finish is mildly sour. Very good.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2017 Old note again. 2009 bottle. Aroma is ultra funky, vinegar like. Taste is great. Funk, sourness, great stuff. Very soft. Rerate. 2009 bottle again! Lovely aroma of sourness and brown bread. Great stuff. Seems like I was trashed both times I had it.
Aroma: dry and fruity; Appearance: clear, light amber; almost no head; Taste: follows nose plus some sweetness; similar to a white wine; Overall: decent, but probably wouldnt pursue getting again.

From a 2006 bottle aged 10 years at the time of pouring. Shared darbeer75 and wombat23. Pours orange with no head or carbonation. Aroma a mix of brandy, apple, and something musty. Sour tartness dominates the taste, sweetens on the finish. Lightly acidic. Decent stuff.

Bottle(750 ml): Hazy, deep golden with an orangey sheen; rich, mainly dry, nose of tart apples and malic acid, citric acid and some cellary notes are also included; moderate to solid dry sour flavour, some residual sugars very hard to detect, light to medium bodied, tart MF, but still quite soft; dry and lingering finish with apples, malic acid and a very slight bitterness. Well drinkable and very pleasant...

From notes. Enjoyed at Dougs house for the Epic Peach and Apricot debacle of a tasting that happened on July 9. 750 mL bottle. The pour is a murky orangey gold color with no head or sign of carbonation. This is a little different. The aroma is interesting. There is a tart vinegar right up front and a bit of yeast, barnyard, light fruit skin, and a bit of dried hay. Its messy. The flavor is much of the same. There is a light stone fruit to it, but its overshadowed. There is a little bit of leather on top of the barnyard and an oaky funk. The mouth feel is oily and flat as fuck. There is no carb at all, and thats an issue I believe. The aftertaste is lingeringly oaky and funky. There isnt much good happening here.

At the epic peach/apricot sour tasting. Aroma is sour, funk, skins, good. Appearance is amber golden, clear, flat. Taste is flat, oak barrel, funk, barnyard, eh. Mouthfeel is flat, light to medium body, oak funk aftertaste. Overall, first unblended did not impress.

Bottle sample tasted at BBF Lab Madrid 2016 on the 02/07/2016. Hazy golden colour whit a white disappearing head. Aroma is leather, sour grapes, lactic and lemon acidity. Taste is very dry, medium sour and light bitter. Aftertaste is light tart, light bitter with herbal and citrus flavor. Next one please!

Bottle (2015), shared by Mart - thanks! Murky orange with no head. Acidic, esters, peach, funk, dirty horseblanket. Acidic finish. Tastes fruity, peachy, sour, earthy and appley. Crisp, sticky, and I repeat: acidic.

750ml c&c bottle from a group that may or may not exist on this site. Poured a super flat sun burnt orange body with zero head from the lack of carbonation. Aroma is tart apple cider vinegar, horse blanket, set leather, yeast, tannins and slight manure. Body is horribly flat, zero carbonation and an average aftertaste on the flavor. Flavor of green apple cider, leather, tannins, horse blanket, light funk and cob webs. Body sucks, actually flatter than water somehow.
750ml bottle of 3 year old, bottled 2/2012. Pours an orange color without any head. No carbonation. Mild lambic flavors, a little zesty sourness.

750ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Cloudy orange color. Tiny size, bubbly head, stays. Sweet, acidic, leather, bit of manure in aroma. Acidic, fruity, apples, leather, rubber in taste. Fruity, apples and rubber in aftertaste. Acidic jammy mouthfeel. Drinkable brew.
Bottle (from belgiuminabox). Pours golden. Aroma is fruity, acidic, oak, citrus, lemon. Flavor is sweet and bitter, peaches, lemon, funk, salty. Finish is dry bitter. Overall: very good.

2015 bottle shared by Mart. Hazy amber, no head. Nose is horse and barnyard, dry notes, tartness, fruit. Flavor is tart, fruity, lemons, salt, earth. Tart finish, medium dry. Almost oily mouthfeel, lingering fruity and earthy dryness. Very nice.

Bottle in Rome. Thanks Mortlach! Still dark gold, clear. No head. A little waft of funky rotting fruit. A little oxidation, lots of sweet fruit juice. Clean, rather tasty, but a little muted. nice treat.

Bottle 2011 at La Capsule, Lille - FR. Color: hazy and cloudy dark golden beer with no carbonation and medium non persistent white foam. Smell: really fruity domination with sourness and wood notes. Very amazing nose. Taste: medium sourness body with floral and fruity domination balanced with good sourness and wood barrel notes. Amazing and superb attenuation. Fruity finish. No sourness. One of the best sour beer tasted. Aftertaste: fish floral and fruity finish. Small sourness and astringent.

Tap at WvdSG. Clear dark golden with a few big bubbles. Light woody, soft white grapes, soft mineral notes, lemon. Under medium sweet with very light bitterness. Under medium bodied with dry feel and no carbonation.
hazy golden liquid without head. aroma is apple cider, earthy. taste has some oak, medium bitter, medium+ sour. light body, thin feel, flat, bitter,
Aroma: mold, apple, soil. Appearance: hazy, golden, no foam. Taste: medium + sourness, medium bitterness. Palate: flat, medium body, astringent, no aftertaste.
75cl bottle @ home, 3YO lambic. Very small head, as you would expect from a lambic. Aroma is apple (vinegar) and lemon. Taste is sour apples, lemon, peach. Overall a well balanced lambic!

750 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled in 2/2012. Pours slightly hazy golden orange color with no head and minimal lacing. Light bubbles sticking to the glass. Aromas of tart lemon, lime, grapefruit, orange peel, green apple, white grape, hay, straw, grass, wet wood, leather, musty funk, light white wine vinegar, light pepper/vanilla, and yeast/oak earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, oak, and light-moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of tart lemon, lime, grapefruit, orange peel, green apple, white grape, hay, straw, grass, wet wood, leather, musty funk, light white wine vinegar, light pepper/vanilla, and yeast/oak earthiness. Moderate acidic/tannic tartness and light yeast/oak spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of tart lemon, lime, grapefruit, orange peel, green apple, white grape, hay, straw, grass, wet wood, leather, musty funk, light white wine vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, oak, and light-moderate pale malt flavors; with a great malt/tartness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from acidity as well. Minimal carbonation and medium body; with a very smooth and moderately acidic/tannic balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with zero warming present after the finish as expected of 5%. Overall this is an excellent unblended lambic style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, oak, and light-moderate pale malt flavors; and very smooth and easy to drink with the balanced acidity. A very enjoyable offering, with plenty of classic lambic flavors.

750ml bottle shared with ippopotamo36 and luttonm. Pours deep golden with no head. Aroma of barnyard, citrus, lemon, balsamic notes, fresh fruits. Flavour is fine and balanced, medium fruity sweetness with a nice sour end. Medium body, no carbonation. Refined!

No foam. No carbonation. The cork is too small in diameter and the air slipstream out! The aroma is by no means excellent. Complex oak citrus funky notes. Sour sweet mouthfeel. To bad that the carbonation is gone. Great potential. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
375 ml. bottle. Thanks Nikos! Pours a hazy golden red with a small white head. Aroma of fruit, citrus, and funk. Taste is apple, lemon, funk, and wood. Excellent.

0,75 bottle. Hazy amber colour. No head. No froth. Really powerful aroma. Grass, wood, hints of spices, white wine, vinegar. Vinegar at first. Barnyard. Wood. Hints of oak. White wine. Sour finish. Light bodied, very low carbonated, fascinating unblended lambic.

Bottle from Dranken Geers. Dated Jan 2015. Bottle opens easily with no pop, and a lot of the gas has gone. Beautiful reddish glow to this delicate looking orange beer, very thin head, only lightly effervescent. Nose is leather, sour, apple vinegar, apple cider, white and oxidised flesh apple, light horseblanket. Not massively funky or farmyardy, but really nice apple and cider fruit with leather. Taste is dry, fruity apple cider, sour apple vinegar, white wine vinegar, tart, citric acid, leather, lactobacillus sour, some tannin like substance on the tongue.
Orange color with almost no head. Soar aroma, with some spices, citrus. Similar taste. Very drinkable.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2015 Bottle shared with TO, SO and PMR at Melkebaren, Sandnes, 19.12.15. Pale orange. Very small head. Clean aroma of brett and citrus. Also some malt. Complex. Astringent mouthfeel.. Good!

Bottle sample at a tasting, thanks Vova! Hazy orange color. Aroma of oak, wine, greeen apples, floral, winegar. Not very sour, floral, wineous, woody, spicy flavors, notes of pepper, lemon peel, grass. Medium-bodied, dry, flat. Pretty good.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel, Tel Aviv. Many thanks for this one. Clear golden with no head. Aroma of wild yeasts, funk, rosemary and some orange peels. Sour flavor with notes of orange, funky, bitter with some black pepper and wood. Flat, medium-bodied. Nice.

At a tasting, many thanks, light hazy palish orange color, aroma vinegar, paper and some spiciness, wood and citrus flavor with some saddle and spice, light sourness and quite mellow. woody oranhe peal bitterness. Really interesting.

(2001 750ml bottle @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Nov 17 2015, split w/ phyllomedusa) Pours clear deep gold with, of course, no head. Aroma is delightfully wet, earthy and funky, like a forest floor with fresh mushrooms and decaying leaves. A bit of brighter herbal blend on top of balanced dry wood core. The palate has a beautiful balance of light acidity, wood, wet leaves, mushrooms, wet earth, lemon/lime zest, a hint of quickly buried white grape. Finish has a bit of lingering acidity but is dominated by wet earth, leaves, soft tannins and mushrooms. Nice umami! Medium bodied and slightly slick, flat. Wow. If this is what 14 years does to oude lambic then it should always be aged that long. Just lovely quality to this beer, so contemplative a sipper.

Occasion rêvée de placer un nouveau style de bière sur Ratebeer avec ce lambic unblend 
Mais le rêve sarrête là en matière de dégustation !!! Pour le reste, cette bière ma rappelé dagréables moments à la Bécasse de Bruxelles, où on dégustait ce type de lambic en groupe sur les fameux bancs de bois, en 
chantant toutes les vieilles fariboles des Marolles et autres joyeuseries propres à amuser lâme
ou le coeur des students que nous étions 
Bref, pas grand-chose à se mettre sous la dent avec ce Oude Lambiek de Gooik, dans ce bizarre
pays du Pajottenland  Même sil a vieilli trois belles années dans les vieux djiboulous de chêne
de plus dun siècle, ce jus de chaussette ne va pas révolutionner lart brassicole 
Niveau abv de 5 % en format de 75 cl.
Couleur orange/mandarine, à la clarté très légèrement voilée.
Quelques bulles éparses, fines et lentes.
Mousse qui est juste un filet blanc contre la paroi du verre.
Arômes de vinaigre, bois de fût, raisin au pressoir, petit vin blanc.
1ère bouche fluide à la saveur aigrelette, sûre, vinaigrée.
Arrière-bouche de vin perlé.
2ème sans aucune ampleur, vague.
Arrière-bouche de petit vin de troquet.
La longueur ne montre aucun développement.
Les jambes sont huileuses.
La levure est spontanée, et pas évidente.
Lalcool est bof. La finale est bof.
CONCLUSION : pas de quoi casser une patte à une mouche, même dans un caberdouche avec un manouche  Mes points vont à létiquette, à lambiance de la Bécasse, et au Manneken Pis ...
Bref, on nirait pas à Bruxelles pour ce lambic, même si moi jy suis allé pour lacheter ...
Et ce nétait pas loin de Molenbeek St Jean, qui, si lon traduit bien pourrait se dire
« le ruisseau aux moulins de St Jean », cest poétique

Huge thanks to sideshowe for sharing. 2003 vintage. 

Pours a dark golden orange color thats almost flat with a one finger, bubbly white head that slowly settles into an impressive lasting ring. Spotty lacing left behind. 

Intense aroma with a great balance of lactic funk, acetic acid, barnyard must, pale malt, light fruit and citrus. Funky lactic cheesiness along with oak, wet grass, cobweb and bandaid followed by acetic vinegar, strawberry and citrus rind. Smells absolutely incredible with barnyard funk, horseblanket, acidity and sweet fruit notes bouncing off of each other . I cant imagine any way in which the aroma could be improved. 

Medium bodied with delicate carbonation and a nice balance of lactic funk, acetic acid, oak barrel and sweet fruit. Tart and puckering with the perfect amount of sourness. Great oak barrel and lactic/cheesy funk flavors along with lingering acetic acid thats complimented by light fruit and zesty citrus. Not solvent-like, harsh or overly acidic with strawberry and orange zest sweetness countering the sour funk. Mouthfeel is incredible with the perfect amount of acetic qulaity that leaves me thirsting for more. Incredibly complex yet insanely drinkable. Excellent!

2012 bottle, shared at my cellar clearing party. Hazy orange, with a ruby hint, and a big, pillowy, beige head. Nose is orange peels, strong cloves, white grapes, and grapefruit. Sweet and citrusy, very tart, with just a touch of bitterness. Light to medium body, crisp, effervescent, and pretty acidic. This is a very pleasant, aromatic, and wonderfully complex lambic.
Reddish tinge. Sour but also a tad watery. Newer vintage.woody.nice but overated.

Wazig perzikkleurig bier met nagenoeg geen schuimkraag.
Hout, citrus en fruit in de neus.
De smaak begint mild en houtachtig wordt dan zuurder met droge afdronk nasmaak. Lichte body met een lichte koolzuur ... Zeer verfrissende Lambiek.
Bottle @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 19/9-15. Fruity, bretty and acidic with woody notes. Body is medium, the finish is dry, fruity, acidic and bretty.
Bottle( 375 ml) @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 150919. Fruity, bretty and acidic, medium body with a watery to oily texture. The finish is dry, fruity and bretty.
Bottle @ mikkeller bar copenhagen. Pours a bronze like beer. Sour and bretty with hints of apples. A velvety sour finish.
Bottle. Gold/orange with no head. Vinegar, fruity sweetness, dusty, light funk, wood, white wine. Flat and sticky on the lips. Tasty.
Bottle at BBF LAb. Golden-orange colour with no head. Sour, fruity, dusty aroma. Sour, sweet and fruity taste. Medium body.

Pours gold with a touch of red. No head.

Nose of barnyard funk with a lemon subnote. As it warms, vinegar is noted.

Light medium body, with a somewhat smooth texture. No effervescence.

The flavor is intense, but lacks complexity and balance. It tastes just like the nose with a tart citric note added
Bottle carlsens. Pours copper with no head. Aroma tart, citrus, sour, horse blanket. Taste is horseplanket, lemon, fruity, green apples, complex, earthy, dusty. Flat carbonation. Intense..

Pours a slightly hazy deep yellow/ orange with hardly any head. The smell is wood, funk, tart fruit, citrus. The taste starts off mild and woody then becomes more acidic tart and dryon the aftertaste. Light body with mild carbonation...very nice.

Golden peach color, no head. Funky nose, fruity, caramel, apple, vinous, hints of vinegar and citrus. Sweet fruity taste, funky, caramel, bread, sour, light astringent finish. Light to medium body, flat carbonation, oily texture. Personal stats: Rating #700

Many thanks to Rian for sharing this 2009 Bottle. Nice tart sourish nose. The beer starts mild sourish, fresh and smooth. The acidity is moderate, the body is soft. The aftertaste has some horse blanket there, very soft mild sour. Great fresh fruity hints, nice and round. Fantastic mild sourish flavour with woody hints.

0.75 l bottle @ One Pint Pub, Helsinki. Quite sour, burns your throat. But thats what I like. More refreshing than hoppy ale which just makes you to more thirsty. Hard to tell if this more or less sour than Cantillons unblended lambic.

June 21, 2015. 750 ml bottle at home, bottled january 2009 (according to the bottle...). 
Clear golden with a small, quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is tart apple skins, lemon, leather, wood, barnyard. Taste is medium acidic with lemon and green apples, some leather and dry wood notes. Lasting medium acidic finish with apple and oak. Light bodied, slightly oily texture, soft carbonation.

750ml botle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Hazy golden orange color with almost no head. Aroma is funky yeasty, horse blanket - barnyard notes, citrusy fruity. Sweet and acidic taste, funky and tart fruity. Medium oily body with soft to flat carbonation.

Bottle, bottled jan 09. Pours clear golden, with as good as no head. Aroma is tart wooden brett, with funky hay and notes of farmhouse. Medium body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is sour, with lactic acid, wooden brett, and farmhouse notes of hay and tart fruity notes.

Bottle with blackened botteling date. Light orange color, no head. Aroma is barnyard, horse blanket, leather, lemon, wine, acid. Taste is light to medium sour and light herbal bitterness. Flavor of dry wine, lemon. Afterteste is dry wine, wood, tartness. Light body, watery texture, no carbonation. Not so complex but still nice one.

Bottle, 2009 -thanks _angst_! Pours clear golden orange, really no head or lacing; a few bubbles perhaps. Aroma is funky, lots of wet basement, horse blanket, some cheese, oak tannins, a bit of fruitiness. Flavor is light tart, medium funky, a hint of fruity sweetness remains. Lots of horseblanket funk on top of oak and a hint of mushroom. Medium body, flat as a board. Pretty solid Gueuze overall.

Aroma of sour fruits, apples, peach, orange, vinegar, some barnyard funk. Flavour is sour and tart with just a hint of sweetness on the tongue. Surprisingly fruity and rather refreshing, an excellent Lambic.

Draft at De Cam. Nice bitterness, lemon, tart. AWESOME. Had this later on in the Volkscafé De Cam, and was much less impressed by it then. Did they add something or was it just a different barrel? Ill score the version I had at the source itself.

Sample at ZBF 15. Poured a dark yellow colour with Some bubbles on top. Aroma of barnyard, green apples, grape skin, hay, oak, tart, lemon zest, funky tart notes, vinegar, old cheese. Nice creamy mouthfeel

UPDATED: APR 27, 2015 10cl draught sample at Zythos Bierfestival, Leuven. 3 years old.  Slightly hazy yellow, slim white head that quickly disappears. Nicely tard and sweet with white grapes and light caramel. Nicely rounded and balanced. Light carbonation, medium body.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2016 Bottle 75cl bought at Dranken Marlou in Zonhoven.
Pours in the beginning of the bottle clear golden with no head and of course no carbonation. It poured hazy golden at the end of the bottle. 
Nose is sour, sewer, citrus, barnyard. Taste: citrus zeste, wet dog, wood, leather, black thee, little bit of vinegar. The aftertaste is pretty dry.
In the beginning of the bottle was the sourness well in balance. As approaching the end of the bottle, the sourness was getting stronger. 
Very well Lambic!!!

Aroma: Yeast barnyard aromas, banana, Peach.
Appearance: clear, golden, no head
Taste: heavily sour, lightly bitter, light sweetness, fruity and fresch.
thin feel, no carbonation.

Tasty!

Corked and caged bottle, 2012. Pour is slightly hazy orange with some head. Nose is cheesy, lemon juice, green apples and some funk. Taste has apple skin, some lime zest, apple juice, funk and some light bitterness. Low carbonation, almost completely flat.
Awesome olfactory aroma of cellar oak cedar barnyard with green apple sharpness. Flat no head. Flavor or sour peaches and hay with some yeasty spice and bread. True classic style lambic. Perfect.
Floral aroma, appear pale light Brown without head. Taste heavy sour. Medium bodied heavy sour aftertaste

Bottled version USA Distribution. Purchased at least 18 months ago and stored in the cellar horizontally. Enjoyed at fridge temp in a Gueuze Tumbler and allowed to warm and decant for a bit.

A - Nice darker orange, bronze / copper colored.....flat, obviously.

S - Nose is cheesy, wet hay, lemon skins and peach juice. A touch of strawberry and spice.

T - This is a very thin beer. Lots of funk, cheese, hay and grass. A little bit of metallic taste, juicy orange. Finish is very thin it does coat the teeth a little bit but not all that sour.

M - Oily, incredibly thin mouthfeel. Lingering copper finish.

O - Its not great compared to most old lambic Ive had but considering its bottled and distributed, not a bad find. The price is steep in USA distro $ 35+ a bottle.
750ml bottle pours out an amber color no head. This thing was totally flat. Nose is green apple leather some dust. Taste is green apple fruits barrel notes and a nice funk.

75cl bottle from cerveteca lisboa, portugal. Color is dark gold, orange. Almost no head. Taste is medium high sour, light to medium sweet, medium bitter. Body is smooth. Aroma is cheese, hop, fruit, citric, brett.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2016 0,75 bottle shared by mortlach. Thank you. Pours clear amber orange color, no head. Nose: over ripe grapes, rotting fruit, stable, rustic. Mouth: elegant, clear easy drinking, sparkling finish.

Bottle @ fermentoren. Pours clear deep orange with no head. Aroma is very raw and authentic with a lot of rural notes, vinegar, horse blanket, oak, apples, weak floral notes and lambik storage room. The taste follows up with notes of horse blanket, fresh and almost floral notes, vinegar, weak vanilla, weak sweet white wine, goose berries and some oak. Ive really come to like the unblended style and for what is is I think it is excellent and delicate.

Bottle at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a clear amber with no head. Aroma has green Apples, dust, leather, vanilla, gooseberry, apricots. Taste is very leathery dry, oaky, tart, but with some sweeter fruit notes. Some sweeter White wine grapes as well. No carb and slightly oily body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared @ Fermentoren. Pours clear dark orange with no head. Aromas of sour green apple, pretty moldy, horseblanket, ripe orange. Taste is vinegary, ripe orange, green apples, lemon, gosebeery, pear, apricots, basement, mold.

0.75 Aged version 2009/2001 (depending if you prefer to believe the card or the label). Pale golden amber cloudy appearance. Very calm impression without foam. 3 jaar. (2009 37cl, som alltid med de Cam... Suck detta är en 75cl och årgång således nån gång efter 2009...)

light carb which is nice for a lambic, good barnyard and farm fuck arounds, awesome balance and lots of gunpowder, fruits, everything really.

Provglas på Brekeriet bar. Ingen kolsyra och lite platt munkänsla för mig som ovan. Men väldigt mjuk och uppfriskande, lättdrucken, äppelcidervinäger, syrliga äpplen, trä, funk, torr, stram men ändå mjuk. Riktigt trevlig.

Bottle split with Mowbeer at Luppolo 12. Served in a wine glass it was a brilliantly clear pink tinted gold with a minimal head. it is lovely clear copper gold.. The nose is spicy pine, earthy hops, sour peppery goodness. The body is silky smooth and light but damn good. Very very nice.
Bottle - Funky, dusty, burnt rubber and soft fruit. Hazy gold orange with no head. Soft stone fruit, light tartness, well balanced and soft. Really nice.
Bottle share. Cloudy orange. Aroma of tart juicy citrus. Taste is awesomely tart. Just plain great.

Orangey with no head or noticeable carbonation. Aroma is cheesy funk, dried peaches, dried pear. Medium-light bodied, funky on the palate with a lightly dry finish. Taste is dried peaches, tangy orange, dry white wine. Nice.

Bottled 2/2012. Drank 5/24/14

Cloudy orange and with no head. Sweet yeasty nose. Medium bodies and lemony

Bottle shared at the RBESG 2014, grand tasting 09/08/2014 Moncada Brewery. Onion skin coloured pour with a fine white head. Aroma is funky socks, musty, splash of vinegar. Sample at the 2014 Infected Chimipalooza on 11/01/2014. Clear copper-gold color with a thin white head that evaporates quickly to a minimal outer ring. Spotty lacing. Orangebrun farge og helt uten skum. Lukter gjær og syrlig. Smaker veldig syrlig og noe frukt. Ettersmaken gir meg samme følelsen som etter å drikke sitron. Surt:-)

Aroma is expansive, lots of citrus, grapefruit and lemon, freshly cut grass. Sourness is predominant but not that intense, not mouth-puckering. Also sweet and juicy, pear and lemon. Complex. Full-bodied.
Pours brownish amber whtout a head. A fruity brew with a balanced tartness, lots of apples and some cellar notes. Very smooth but with a hint of carbonation.
Lys brun tåkete uten skum. Lukter surt, rødvinseddik, gjær og sitrus. Syrlig smak av eddik, stregress og sitron, lime. Uten kullsyre.

Drucken på Stockholm Beer & Whiskey Festival. Funderar på om denna var avslagen. Rätt svag i kolsyran och det andra. Hade väntar mig mer.

On cask at De Cam. Hazy blond with small white head. Aroma is barnyard funk, lemon and hay. Taste is puckering lemon; citric and lactic sourness. Very easy drinking and nice complexity.

Sample from bottle at Ölrepublikens surölsfestival. Clear copper with no head. Smell is sour green apples and funky stables, horse, oak and wet wool. Taste is sour balanced with quite big body. Funky with wet wool, stables and oak barrel.

At Stephens with Stephen and Dave. Pours orange piss. Aroma is beautiful Gueuze tartness, very nice. Taste, sour beautiful subtle amazing Lambic. I could drink this every day with dinner. Awesome Gueuze would love to get some and age it.

Bottle. Hazy amber liquid with minimal white head. Aroma of leather, wood, apples, barnyard, lemon and fruity funk. Taste is dry to light sweet and medium sour with notes of leather, apples and barnyard. Medium bodied with very low carbonation. Really nice and drinkable.

Pours a very clean golden color with no head. Aroma is acidic and ripe fruits. Apple, pear, white grape must. Mouthfeel almost like a wine. Very smooth, and refreshing. No head and no carbonation. Acidic with some real funky tones of wheat, hay, grass and barn in there. A dash of citrus and green apples.

Glad I got to try it though, and get my Unblended Lambic tick.

Light to medium body, watery texture, soft/flat carbonation, fairly dry and long finish with light to moderate bitterness. Pretty tender and drinkable Lambic. That doesnt weaken its quality... Rustic and with a great balance and drinkability. Very thin and almost flat, like the style requires, with just more bitterness than expected.

Cloudy orange with no head. Tart and sweet aroma resembles fermented apples with bit cherry and other berries, funky basement also, quite lively and nuanced aroma and lots of it. Really tart and dry but fruitiness gives kinda balancing feel of sweetness, long tart finish, light body, low carbonation, light body and feel gives bit easy-to-drink feeling but is highly tart so at least I more sip this slowly. Unique and challenging but pure and interesting also. Like mentioned before this has vinegar in both aroma and flavor and have to agree that aroma is more rewarding here.

Smak och doft av jäst, citron, grapefrukt, omogna gröna äpplen, vita vinbär, hö, vinäger med toner av röda bär och trä. Fruktig, syrlig. Smakrik men saknar helt kolsyra vilket hade tillfört ytterligare en dimension.

12/23/13. 750mL bottle from Moline Hy Vee, cost split by cbfobes, thankfully. Expensive bottle. No pop from the bottle when the cork was pulled. Apple juice colored pour, a deep golden copper, I suppose, with no head, no carbonation, completely flat. Fantastic aroma, lots of funk, hay, some vinegar, lightly tart. Awesome. Disappointing flavor, watery, mild funk, vinegar, tartness, straw.

Bottle. Poured hazy reddish color with an minimal frothy white head that mostly lasted with fair lacing. Moderate to heavy sour yeast and tart fruit aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium sour fruit flavor with a medium sour finish of moderated duration. This is a solid for style beer.

Bottle shared by drowland at xmas, pours a hazy goldish amber with no head at all, in fact there wasnt any carbonation at all, not even a hint of it. Aroma is acidic with a little bit of funk and a hint of skunk from the green bottle, the flavor has a tart front end with really dry finish, the lack of carbonation really affects it though and the mouthfeel suffered from it, was hoping for more.

750 ml bottle shared with the group. Pours a clear orange amber color with no head. The aroma and flavor have orange and lemon citrus, tart, funk, acidity and all that is good. The lack of carbonation leaves this thin and a bit watery. I like the flavor, but the mouth feel is lacking.

750ml bottle - split 4 ways with b3shine, tmoney99, and alexsdad06. Bottled 2/2012. Pours a clear orange color, with little to no head. Great oaky, citrusy, lightly lemony aroma. Unfortunately, the beer is virtually completely flat. Medium body. Lightly slick texture. Taste is very nice, good level of tart, sort of dry. Nice lightly funky lambicy aroma. Nice basementy mustiness. Complex, but a little subtle... Just a little carbonation would have helped quite a bit to propel the aroma.

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared between myself, Tmoney99, alexsdad06, and DrSilverworm). Bottled 2/2012. Looks solid; no real carbonation though. A transparent golden orange. Smells good; funky with what I can only describe as pleasant notes of baby shit and cat piss (yep, I know that sounds asinine). Tastes like an unblinded lambic; not as robust though, and no carbonation whatsoever. Average (at best) on the palate. Smells much better than it tastes.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2014 Delicious and pleasant beer. Had a light earthiness and a gentle funkiness. Mild carbonation made it feel soft on the tongue. Nice dose of sourness, but it wasnt puckering. Pleasant fruit and yeast ester aromas of lemon, pear and apricot. Brett hints in the background. Great stuff, though the $40 we paid for the bottle (in a bar) wasnt so great. Rerate (bottle in Belgium): Similar thoughts. Pleasant sourness and a nice tartness. Fruity notes of cherries, pears and grapes. Light vanilla in the aftertaste.

February 2012 vintage. Bottle purchased at Ale Yeah for $35 after tax. The beer pours to a glowing bronze body with no head. The aroma is extremely leathery and funky like a mix of Iris and Cuvee Rene. The flavor is lemons and funky leather with horse blankets and flowers. Raw funk. Sour.

[275ml bottle, The Bottle Shop, Canterbury] Three year old bottle, aged and enjoyed. Pours slightly hazy golden yellow, with a thin white lacing. Aroma is only mild funk, mostly sweet fruit, some apple, just a rich honeysuckle on the nose - and on the palate. Once the main act hits, theres a wonderful moment before the slight tartness arrives, like a pickled finish. Aged beautifully, this beer is outstanding [03122013]

2005, thank you Bucketboy. Pours golden brown somewhat clear with almost no head. Aroma brings some refreshing lemony flavor, but subtle tart lambic yeast. Flavor is pretty tart on a decent body, clean for sure and goes down smooth. Not overly puckering tart, and enjoyed and pleasant.

Not sure what to say I loved this beer completly. I was already a touch drunk but couldnt pass up. Pours lovely orange and completely flat. Nose is amazing just fresh drink me beer of garden, light fruit, and wine. Tastes of light vinegar, fruity juicy fruit gum, fresh spring water, some woody taste. Nice light palate. Seriously amazing.

Bottle shared at Moeder Lambic, 2009 vintage. Pours clear golden with an off white head. Aroma of big barnyard funk brettiness and tart light fruits. Flavour is moderate to heavy sour. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Pours clear yellow two finger white head.

Smell big wheat and funk, sour and diaper/bandaid.

Taste very funky sour, citrus peel, adhesive, lemon and wheat.

Fizzy and light body.

Good

bottle of 3 year old lambic. Pours with a hint of carbonation, orange with very thin white lace around the glass. Aroma is sweet lemon with some funk and sweat with some must. Tastes is mildly acidic upfront with hints of bitter citrus, the middle is very funky with leather and horse blanket notes, finishes dry and tart. Very nice.
Hazy orange coloured beer with small head and no carbonation. Sour hopped aroma. Medium palate. Finish is sour sweet ending deep sour.
shared with yves at his home hazy golden blond coloured body with a white head and with a fruity sweet sour aroma a fruity sweet sour taste with a little sweet sour bitter finish

pours hazy bright golden with a small whtie cap, some retention and lacing. fruity and mellow - pineapple, white grapes, oakiness, hint of vanilla, grass, touch of minerals. bright to average carbonation, light body - oily, grassy and dry bretty finish. very good stuff!

Removing the cork produces no sound. Very thin white head
quickly disappears entirely. Nearly clear coppery body with
light carbonation. Funky apple and wood aroma with earthy floral
notes. Dryish-acidic waxy barnyard taste with winter apple
notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, flat mouthfeel. Dry-acidic waxy winter
apple aftertaste with oily barnyard notes. Odd. Its really
different from geuze, and not really that acidic. Feels like
theres a good bit of sugar left. Nice. (0.375l bottle. Not sure
where from, as wife reorganized the beer crates without asking
me.)

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2014 Bottle (750 ml). Clear golden with a small white head and little to no lacing. Aroma is mostly of barnyard along with light fruits, light sweetness and leather. Taste is mild (delicate) but very interesting with light fruits/citrus notes, barnyard, light sweetness, leather a nice acidic touch. Medium body. Low carbonation. Slightly dry finish. Very good Oude Lambiek. Delicate, yet very complex. De Cam is making nice stuff. 8-4-8-4-16 = 4.0

UPDATE: Tried it directly from the barrel at De Cam. It was 3 years old Boon Lambik, but so different than the Boon Oude Lambiek. Clear golden with a small white head. Aroma was so smooth with gentle notes of funk, barnyard, minerals and fruits. Taste was also smooth and delightful with funk, mineral notes, light barnyard, fruity notes and wood. Light body (but not weak). Almost no carbonation. Dry woodsy finish. This is the smoothest and the most easy drinking unblended lambic Ive had the chance to try. So quenching and tasty. Delightful.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours golden with no head. Aroma is of barnyard, funk, citrus, sugar. Taste is of barnyard, funk, citrus, sourness. Palate: Very light body. Overall: Nice barnyard here. Pretty good lambic stuff.

0.375l corked bottle from Jan 2009. This is a heavy blurry golden-orange beer with a medium sized quickly fading and quite bubbly little just off-white top. The aroma fills the room with woody bretty lambiek aroma. Lovely. Its quite fruity this actually. Old collared yellow apples and apricots, red berries like red currants, the wood is really present and it just smells exactly like what I was expecting and hoping for. It has a nice almost fizzing average carbonation level but the mouthfeel is almost what I would call watery. Good bretty flavors. More of those old apples that has been sitting in the cellar a bit to long. Woody tart, slightly lemon-ish and it has a slight sweetness towards the finish. The finish and aftertaste is gone a bit quicker than I like, but thats just to lift the glass once more, have a sip and the flavors are back in the mouth. Really refreshing and tasty. Paired great with a big homemade entrecote hamburger. Hmm.. That bottle went quick! 12.02.2013

750 ml C&C bottle served in a mini snifter. 2003 vintage (MMIII on label). Shared at Northdown with the crew.

A: Pours a hazy orange color with no head forming on the pour. Flat as a pancake.

S: Super funky witha minerally quality to it. Lemon grass with a nice lactic bite. Pretty acidic as well, but the the funk is the star of the show here.

T: The taste follows the nose with the funk. Banyard in nature it very punget and sharp. Light acetone with some sour warhead lemon bite and some lemon grass bitterness.

M: Flat and light bodied. Smooth, sour and dry. Still really nice.

O: This was a really sneaky hit for the night. Even though it was flat it was still deliciously complex. I wish I had another.

Serving type: bottle

09-05-2013

750mL from Grant long ago.

A: Solid orange with a very thin white head. Good lacing.

N: Oak, banana, cedar, horse blanket, grapefruit, lemon. Potent.

T: Quite sour with a balancing malt base. Some wheat and pepper. Plenty of lemon. Not as densely packed as its superiors but worthy. 

M: Very light and a touch oily.

O: An interesting lambic. Can tell its less mature from the barrels, though the intervening years in the bottle have been kind.

Bottle that I have owned for some time now G8 printed on the cork 2003 bottling. Had no idea until tonight that this was so old. Pour has a yellow golden color with some white foam but no real head and no visible carbonation. Aroma has firm acidity, lemon, some horse blanket, and tart white grape skin. Mouth feel is average for the style on the coating side of things but the almost total lack of carbonation is a bummer. Flavor cranks on the dry acidity, lemon, light flowers, some barnyard, and a long intense finish. Great beer in itself but if I am reading this right is made up of 3 year old lambic and for me missing the younger lambic in the blend takes a bit of the complexity away. Great beer for its age!

Bottled at the Leiderkerke Beer Festival. Dark golden color with lace. Light bubbues. Leathery, dusty nose, citrus, horse blanket, a touch of caramel. Funky citrus flavor, books, leather, pepper. Slightly sour.

Wonderful Lambic from the bierkoning ! Tremendous in its sour front with raspberries and lemons in the aroma. Ending quite dry and full bodied. Berries all the way so far - quite to compare with a good vine.

0.75 l bottle from bierkoning - dank je wel! Pours out in a cloudy light amber / orange colour with no real head and medium body. Absolutely flat. Nose of sourness, nuts and hops. Taste of acid, citrus, nuts, torf and grains. Hints of yoghurt. Absolutely refreshing and great to drink. Enjoyed it a lot.

0.33l bottle. Slightly hazy orange body, quickly disappearing white head. Aroma of lemon zest, cheese and grapes. Taste is really sour, mostly lemon zest with hints of cheese, grapes and caramel maybe. The body is light-medium. Nice lambic.

bottle three year old jan 2009. Oude lambiek. Hazy orange gold little head, but super carb. Aroma of honey vinegar acetate. Tastes strongly of yeast and dust with a brett like funk. Theres a metallicness. The yeast is really flattening out the acid here which is good for me; lambics arent my thing. Seems tolerable for an unblended one... not insanely harsh. But Id still rather have a gueze or possibly lick a wrestling mat instead to get my stanky flavor fix.

750 ml bottle courtesy of Secret santa. Thanks. Pours a cloudy amber color with minimal head that instantly vanishes away. Perhaps this is a Jonge Lambik. The aroma is disgusting with extra funky horse blanket, whores dirty sheets and some barnyard bouquet--very nice. The flavor, like the aroma, is overtly funky with overripe fruits, cider, spoiled tart green apples, bit of sugar, oak and cedar. The palate is full and smooth with very soft carbonation. Finishes long and tart. Overall: I loved this, funkiest beer Ive had in a long time. Thanks Santa you clearly went above and beyond to get me this.

Bottled from Ølbutikken
Deep orange with no head. 
Sour citrus in the aroma. 
Almost flat. 
Very nice, tart flavour. Extremely drinkable!

Bottle, 3 jaar oud, botteldatum: Jan. 2009. Light hazy yellow with a tiny head. Farty, grapes, sour red berries, wood, juicy apples. Taste is medium sweet and sour. Light/medium body, oily texture, flat carbonation. Good drinkability.

750ml, caged and corked bottle. Slightly hazy golden color with a smaller sized head. Aromas of citrus, manure, barnyard, moldy cheese, and some fruitiness. Tastes of citrus, funky, barnyard, and fruity.

2009 bottle @ home. 1997 bottle @ Akkurat.

This is an amazing lambic. Karel is a great blender. Very elegant with a nice sourness to it.

(draught) pours a hazy golden colour with a small white head. aroma of bread dough, yeast, vanilla and nettles, with a hint of butter and sweatsocks. flavour is mostly the same, herbal hops and nettles are dominant, with a hint of green tea, lemons and yeasty bread dough. light to medium-bodied with very soft carbonation.

Bottle bottled January 2009. Pours cloudy golden with a small off-white head. Aroma of lemon, sour berries, some funk, some leather and malt. Flavor is sour lemon with some malt, berries, leather and funk. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Bottle 750ml vintage 2009 @ Geokkjer
Pours slightly hazy copper/amber with a small off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, tart, barnyard, some fruits. Taste is light to medium sweet and light to medium sour with a smooth and sour finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is flat.

750mL bottle at Grote Dorst, pours a cloudy dark orange with a medium white head. Aroma of incredibly complex barnyard funk, dry leather, and dry notes. Flavour is incredibly complex, with insanely complex barnyard funk, leather and more barnyard. Amazing depth, with such a deep complexity. The funkiness is of such a remarkably complex level. Very drinkable and a pleasure to drink. Amazing stuff.

Sample @ TdG 13. The pours slightly hazy gold with a tiny head. The aromas of apple skin, lemon orchard, brett. The taste is more of the same. A bit of cobweb and brett. Smooth lemon sherbet. Notes of hay and dried grass. Soft carbonation, light body. Pretty solid.
nice lambic! clear amber color. nicely tart not that dry but ofc some dryness. funky and fresh! really nice stuff!

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2014 
355 ml bottle @ hotel room, Copenhagen. Bottled on 01/2009.
Not as extremely sour as the older vintage, nice and sour anyway. Somewhat juicier than I remembered. Definitely not as good as the older vintage.
Rating for the newer vintage: 7-3-7-3-15.
75 cl bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Bottled on 10/2000.
Originally rated on 20110318.
Pours golden color with a minimal head. Aroma of sour fruits, grapes, some grassy notes and yeast. Flavor of yeast, fruits, earth and some leathery notes. Nice.

37,5cl Bottle @ home. Dark blond to light amber coloured beer some light carbonation and a very small white head. Lovely sweet sour fruity grainy balanced aroma. Full palate, rather smouth. Finish is fruity grainy, sour-tart noted. Nice unblended lambic.

Bottle shared by  Pallieter85, thanks! Lightly cloudy golden colour. Aroma really yeasty (brett) green apples, tempting. Taste is lightly tart, lightly vinegary. Very light green apples. Overall good.

Bottle (bottled january 2009) brought to our tasting by Pallieter85, many thanks. Hazy golden color with small white head. Aroma of lemon, vinous notes, funk. Dry tart taste with notes of wood. Tart finish. Nice.

75cl bottle from The Bottle Shop Canterbury.  Flat hazy dark gold colour with no head.  Lemon sour aroma bit of farmyard.  Its wonderful.  Its beautiful.  I cant really tell you why or how or what.  But its just so wonderful.  Woody, grapefruit, lemon.  Sour on finish.  Gooseberry on finish.  Extraordinary.

750ml bottle from 2009. No pop or anything when uncorked. Pours a golden-tinged copper with moderate topping of bubbles. Fairly muted aroma of sharp lemon and white wine vinegar. Thin up front on the palate before opening up slightly. I expected a bracing sourness but its actually quite mellow with little carbonation. A good lesson in lambic because it really shows what the young brew adds to this to form gueuze. Without it the beer seems to really miss that youthful element. Interesting on its own but just doesnt sit right with me.

Bottle at home from drinkstore

Burnished gold with slight lacing of white head and strong citric acid on nose. Light honeydew melon on swirling. Touch of barnyard manure, quite sour up front, lemon fruit pastilles and light carbonation finishing fairly dry and acidic. Interesting to try the building blocks.

2003 vintage tasted blind. Pours clear golden with a thin white head. Nose is apricots, lemon, and a light musty funk. Pretty clean and crisp. Taste is much the same, with some yogurt and a mellow fruitiness on the finish. Soft and light bodied. Wonderfully drinkable.

was afraid i would be able to drink a full bottle of pure lambiek. turned out fdiffrently ! 
bottle at de kelk. 
purs blonde, small white foam ( where did that come from ? ) 
smells sour, taste is funky , good , very complex, dopesnt get borning at all !

Bottle (January 2009): The aroma consists of light funk, cheese, must, apple, and faint lemon. It pours a slightly hazy golden-orange with a few white bubbles for a head that quickly fade leaving it look still. The flavor starts with a quick dose of apple the finish has lemon, must, and oak. Its light bodied with minimal carbonation.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2013 Bottle (75 cl), courtesy of Dunbar72. Shady golden, no head. Wood, green apples, some grapefruit, some fruity notes. Light to medium bodied, almost no carbonation. Dry, firm acidity, some peel bitterness. Very nice and hugely drinkable.

75cl Bottle at Sloshfest. Clear golden colour, thin white head. Aroma of sour lemon, funk, soft sweetness, light floral. Flavour is crisp, sour, lemon, light acidic but within limits, nice soft lemon sour finish. Really nice and clean, unexpected surprise.

Oude lambiek, 3 jaar oud. Botteldatum jan 2009. Smells like horse piss. No head, amber colored, syrupy but sour as hell. Quite special but I miss the carbonation that is in the Oude geuze. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2003 bottling, 11/18/2012. Pours golden orange amber, with actually a small haze of carbonation on the surface, ring around the glass. Aroma is musty, funky basement, bit cheesey, with mildly tart apricot, other white fruit notes, sour malts, wood. Taste is mellow, mild tart grapefruit and citrus, barnyard, malts, more white fruit in the finish. Light palate, slick and refreshing. Nice, mellow, true lambic.

This is the 2000 batch bottled in 2003 that came to the US earlier this year. Amber orange color with actual carbonation, it isnt still. Aroma is funky lambic and a bit of must. Flavor is sour lambic but nothing mind-blowing. Ive had bottles of Cantillon bruocsella that were better and some that were worse. This was definitely not worth the $32 I spent and the De Cam gueuze is better.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-24-2011 21:51:21
2012.11.10 - bottle 37.5cl - orange lambic, bit hazy - nose :  tart, oak mouth : tart fruit, oak, dry finish - very drinkeable

Bottle from Barley Wine, Cph. Jan 2009 bottling. Golden pour, totally still. Aroma is strong on the brettanomyces. Very smooth oak, moldy basement, soft orange, lots of barnyard and leather, a bir farty. Very mellow and well integrated aroma. Taste is very nicely balanced and easy drinking. Complex brett profile, orange zest and grape notes, almost socks. Lots of oakiness dryness. Hot damn this is a nice beer. Excellent example of what to wish for in a straight lambiek.

Bottle:2009:
No head, an almost clear orange colored beer.
Smell cellar, dust, farm, old dusty lemon, wood, old grains, farmhouse.
Taste yeast, light sour, sparkling, light light bitter, older hops, cellar, light dry, nice yeasty sour, old hops, older herby malts, horseblanket, sparkling and light crispy, some dry plants and grains and old dusty farm cellar.
Aftertaste of light sour, dry, light bitter, dried plants, oldd herbs and hops.
Low to no carbo, soft mouthfeel, medium to lightly fuller body and a watery texture.
Very nice beer!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
75cl bottle, bottled 10/2005 shared with Tomaz.
Orangée, léger col beige surtout sur les rebords.
Arôme malté boisé, grains avec ce léger funk.
Palais présente une aigreur très prenante avec ce profile terreux et sec voire poussiéreux. Note de cuire et de fruits trop mûris/fermentés. Le tout procure ce profile unique qui fait grincer les dents et titille le haut du palais. Nest pas dans les plus aigres que jai pu goûter mais à certainement une belle place dans la liste.
Bottle with Ben. Slightly deep Gold with a white head. Carbonation is soft. Strong funky aroma. Flavour is typical farmyard with lemons and grapefruit. Tart and sour with a fairly smooth finish.

Bottle. Pours golden yellow with a white head, looks like sparkling apple juice. Aroma has lambic funk with a sour apple and touch of honey, must. Taste has sharp green apple, funk. Slight sweetness with tart finish. Good
bottle at bens ... amber ... funky peach nose ... tart front ... that  funk ... light lemon finish .. soft peachyness ... not me at all

Oude Lambik Bottle Marked 3 years old ... Pale to clear golden pour light orange tint, thin white head that disappeared very fast .... aroma is strong and of tart rindy lemons, lightly acidic, barnyard, funky and light vinegar ..... taste of tart lemon, lightly acidic, light vinegar ... mouthfeel is flat .... funky and lightly bitter from start to finish with light wood aspects .... finish is bitter, sour and dry ... awesome brew

September 2, 2012 bottle shared by Brandon. Orange yellow pour with almost no head and spotty lacing.  While many lambics I have had rock the barnyard funk, this one had more of a musty basement funk in the aroma and taste.  Light to medium body and very well balanced though not to the level of a Cantillon.  Bottle marked as 3 years old.

Has a big time yeast funk, a little moldy funk as well. Taste is a big lemon bitter at first, sourness fades slowly. I believe it's a good mid range sour beer, helping me grow into the style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks Chris !  Had the chance to drink this in Ebenezers Lambic Bar... 3yr Still Lambiek.  Poured a light golden color with amazing clarity and perfectly still.  Aromas are pure basement funk, dusty oak, hay and the slightest bit of fruit.... the palate followed the nose nicely with amazing complexity and subtleness.  Absolutely blown away by the balance and focus of this bottle. Not too tart or too sour but both elements evenly dialed to perfection.  Wow what a pleasure to drink and share with such a gracious host !

Pours a hazy orange-yellow color with no head and a seemingly flat appearance.  Barnyard funk aroma with hay, and grapefruit.  Tart funk flavor with grapefruit noted along with some vinous notes.  A great beer!

Bottle shared by drabmuh. Thanks Matt!

This beer appears very hazy and orange hued, with virtually no head whatsoever. It looks almost completely uncarbonated. The aroma is great, with notes of hay earth, tart citrus, straw. The beer is very enjoyable, with a dry finish. Oude Lambiek De Cam has enough tartness to cause your cheeks to pucker after each sip. This brew is a solid example of an unblended lambic, and a beer I would certainly drink again.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-12-2011

2009 bottle, 3 year old Lambic. It pours clear golden orange, with no head. The nose is white wine, vinegar, farmyard, hint of manure and floral notes. The taste is unbelievably smooth, tart lemon, vinous, white grape, white currant, crackers, parmesan, some dryness, farmyard and light acidity, with a crisp, tart finish. Medium body and pretty much flat. Highly drinkable. Very well balanced and nothing short of delicious. An amazing unblended lambic. A 750ml bottle didnt quite seem enough..

Bottle from a friends cellar.  It says 3 years old on the bottle and the only marking that looks like a date is MMIII (2003?).  Pours light gold with a minimal head.  The aroma is grassy.  The initial taste is sour and vinegary but it mellows to a slightly sweet aftertaste.  OK, but not my favorite style.

The label says that the beer was bottled in January of 2009. Picked this one up at a bottle shop in Brugge & crushed it at tKeizershof probably while the wife was snoozing. 
I was pretty much amazed when I took the foil off the top of the bottle to find that there was no cage on the cork. Just a cork sticking halfway out the bottle.  

Pours a golden color, basically flat with some bubbles at first. With the lack of cage I expected this to be dead flat but there was a tiny bit of head.  

The aroma is intensly funky and very much like a barn-yard. The sour cherry notes are nice as is the mild brine. This beer is very very pungent.  

The flavor is less intense than the aroma but its every bit as enjoyable, plenty of earthyness, lemon, citrus rind, and yogurt. This lambic is not overly sour and skips out on pretty much any vinegar notes completely. Its elegant and complex, just a wonderful beer.  

The sharp palate is perfect uncarbonated, this is a beer that needs no bubbles.

Pours a hazy bland color with little or no head.  Aroma has mildly tart barnyard funk...very funky!...faint lemony acidic notes and very faint leather.  Flavor follows suit and adds a nice oaky dimension.  Mouthfeel is light and the finish is oaky and tart with faint leather/lemon...dry.

The aroma hits hard with so much going on, I cant say what Im detecting. It pours a thin clear orange with no head or lacing.  The taste is quite similar to champagne with the exception that its refreshing in the end. Its kind of sour up front but still quite drinkable. Perfect for relaxing & just sipping. A very interesting style to me & VERY hard to find - oude bottle from monks in Philly. Very solid beer despite the big price tag!

On draught at De Cam Volkscafe, thanks very much to Pieter Pannecoeck for buying this! Pours a dark golden colour with no head. A lovely aroma of musty horse blanket, wet cardboard, lemon and oak. Similar flavours and quite tart with a dusty, dry finish. Very low carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. Lovely.

2003 vintage, De Cam Oude Lambiek. 750ml C+C bottle into a tulip glass. 5% abv.

A - Dark amber body. First pour was sediment free but somewhat hazy. Some large bubbles form some edging and there a is a very faint cap. This doesnt stick around for too long. Light lacing after a swirl.

S - Super funky and sour. Lemons, green apple, and some grass and hay. Oaky with some vanilla tannins and light spice. The finish is of vinegar and strong brett notes. 

T - Somewhat watery and thin, but still complex and layered. Juicy apples and pears followed by some mouth puckering lemon juice. Smooth oak finished by funk, leather, vinegar, and some very faint but welcomed oxidation. 

M - Rating this to style, and its just about perfect. Very still with no carbonation. The body is light to medium. Drinks like a wine, with a very dry finish and lingering tartness.

O - A world class beer. Its just held up so well over the nearly ten years its been in a bottle. Really complex and layered, yet approachable and drinkable. Certainly worth the wait.

Bottle marked with MMIII  - Also marked as 3 Years Old, Oude Lambiek to be clear about it. It poured with a minimal head as expected with an apple cidar coloration, but I gave it a harsh pour to try and get something out of it, which I did. I poured it into a tumbler, and I found that this minimal fine bubbled head was off white in color, with some modest sticky lacing present, for what that is worth.

The nose mellowed out fairly quick like, with the nose of peppery spiciness, some clear lambic funkiness, light fruitiness of peach, and grass. The flavor profile is quite nice for me ; There is an initial lemon grass note, more pepper, some peach, with a very nice meshing of all elements, finishing on the dry side. There is a tartness present here as well that I did not quite notice immediately -  It doesnt feel overly complex, but it does feel pretty fantastic overall, based on my sampling. Quite nice.

25.4 oz bottle.  Neon orange with a wisp of white haze.  Nose is sour apricot, minerals and champagne vinegar.  Medium light, a touch oily, with dull carb.  Taste is white wine, horse blanket and lime.  Quite smooth with toned down sour and funk.

Totally flat (as expected), golden body. Cider, some spicess. Not as sour as you might image, but does have a nice flavour development. Drinks very well actually. Nice. (75cl bottle, at dEnk house tasting)

Bottle at mini-dEnk tasting. 6 years old. Clear golden pour, no head. Aroma of blue cheese, sweaty socks and basement. Flavor is slightly sour, a bit sweaty and without carbonation. Very smooth and drinkable. Nice balance.

Aroma is sour and somewhat tart with earthy notes and hints of lactic acid. Flavour is also sour with earthy and leathery notes. Dry and leathery finish. The sourness is really nice here, almost as good as 3F lambic.

Aroma has earthy notes, some grapefruit and . Flavour has strong grapefruit tones, some citrus and earthy tones. Sour and still rather neat.

Apple juice appearance and aroma.  Funky lambic smell.  Aged 5 years.  Apple tartness as well. Tried at the Bruges bierfest in 2012 with Jess and Dave.

brewed in 2000, bottled in 2003. pours a deep yellow with a slight copper and orange tint. basically no head what so ever minus a bit around the rim. a nice amount of funk with a nice sour lemon and citrus. bits of oak through out this. starts off with some funk. nice lemony sourness kicks in and carries it through the finish. hints of apricot and peach. a dry oak flavor finishes this off. for an unblended lambic, this has some decent carbonation. tart and dry. this is delicious, one of the best unblended lambics i have had. Poured gold in color with no head.  A nice mild lambic.  Not very good notes this time...

Notes:  Tour de Gueuze 11
Hazed brown pour. Light brown sugar and a hinto sourness on the aroma. Sour malt, flat bread, and a light earthy bitter. Meidum bodied beer. Can you say oooo5?
2003 bottle shared by Madvike. Not sure what to say other than this is good.  Cant wait to try this again.

750 ml bottle bought @ Etre Gourmet. Shared at epic tasting on February 11. Pours slightly hazy (almost clear) golden with no head worth mentioning. Smell is sour and tart with lemon juice, green apples, hay, horse blanket and minerals. Taste is very sour with apples, green grapes, lemon peal, hay, moss and red currants. Mouthfeel is slightly watery with no carbonation. Finish is tart with lemon juice and grape zest.

On tap as 3 year old lambiek, De Oude Cam
Light amber colour, slight white diminishing (lambic) head. Very floral aroma, quite tart, spicy wood, earth, citrus, light lactic acid. Dry lambic flavour, tart but very drinkable, still some light sweetness in the background. Very light carbonation. Slightly astringent. Old but still very much alive. Easily the best lambic at BBF this year.
(Draught @ 5th BBF, Brugge 2012)

Acidic, sour, currants scent. acidic, sour, lactic, vinegar taste. Medium mouthfeel, mouthpuckering dry very low bitterness.7/3/7/4/14=3.5

Courtesy of _angst_. Pours cloudy copper amber with a minimal bubbly rim of head. Aroma is sour, tart, fruity, horse blanket. Flavor is sour, not too tart, very drinkable, fruity, grapes, bitter. Finishes sour fruity.

(Bottle) pours clear orange with no head. The aroma holds lots of brett - horse blanket, moldy basement and barnyard. Undertones of cheese, citrus, tart berries, wet stone, wet sand, earth, tart white grape, light wood and cracker-like malt. The flavour light sweet to dry and medium to heavily acidic. Citrus, brett, lacto, crackers and tart berries. The mouthfeel is flat and tart with no carbonation. Citrus and light phenols on the finish. Light to medium bodied.

Bottle @ Too many Geuzes - only one toilet , Ulfborg 2012 - Day 1.  Vintage 2000 bottle. Clear golden/amber with a tiny head. Aroma and flavor of malt, lemon, barnyard, lemon, brett, horse blanket. Quite sour, you can easily tell it is quite old, but also very enjoyable.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Vintage 2000. Clear amber without head. Aroma is sweet, malty, yeasty and moderate sour - barnyard. Flavor is medium sweet, moderate sour and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 270112

Bottle @ FOneFan. Slightly hazy deep golden with tiny quickly diminishing white head. Aroma is malt, tart and a little citrus. Flavour is malt, wheat, tart, little citrus, sour, little citric, little barnyard and medium dry.

Bottle from year 2000 @ fonefan tasting. Small head with short duration.Color is amber. Aroma and taste are brett, stable, leather and malt. Tart and earthy.

Pours deep slightly hazed gold into a tulip.  White bubbly head recedes leaving trailing spots. Funky horse, marshmallow and sour tropical fruit aromas.  Thin with sour funk and tropical flowers upfront. Turning to dry grapefruit pith in the lasting finish.

Bottle. Clear gold pour, very smallish white head. Aroma is quite fresh smelling, some peppermint, white wine notes, oak, funk. Taste is winey, this impression is increased by the very low carbonation in this beer. Nice tart flavor, well balanced even if pretty intense. Pretty darn tasty.

75cl bottle. 2000 vintage. Pours hazy golden with no head, a ring of bubbles at most. Aroma is sweet-ish with barnyard and leather. Taste is initially sweet-sour with grass, funk, citrus, light bitterness and some woody notes. Very smooth. No carbonation but easy to drink. Very tasty and very solid.

Bouteille de 750 ml, lors de la dégustation à laveugle de gueuzes organisée par David. Arômes rustiques de brettanomyces, présentant également un côté mentholé. Robe orangée, effervescence assez faible aux bulles très fines, peu de mousse. En bouche, la bière se montre relativement peu acide pour le style et demeure très facile à boire. On retrouve une belle présence rustique et authentique de brettanomyces et un côté fruité rappelant les pelures dorange. Intéressant !

2000 Vintage bottle shared by ygtbsm94.  Pours clear gold with a spare white head, no retention or lacing.  Aroma is black walnut, hay and straw malt, lactic, grapes, and oak.  Flavor is lactic sourness, grapes, oak, straw malt, faint phenols, and a dry finish.  Light body, low warmth and carbonation.

750mL 2000 ed thanks to ygtbsm94. The man, the myth, the legend survives! Pours a crystal clear golden with a thin white bubbly film. Uninspiring but correct and expected for this rare style. Nose is very dusty with barn, oak, lemon sections, and serious citrus funk. Taste is dry, crisp, very dusty overall with white grapefruit bitterness and acidity. Very nice stuff- not quite as juicy as De Cam Geuze. Crisp, refreshing, lots of apricot and peach in the finish. Long, quenching aftertaste.
Very little carbonation.  Awesome funky, woody, barnyard and bandaid aroma.  Very tart sour flavor.  Earthy and funky.  Very  nice crisp and easy to drink.

jan-2009 bottle. Pours brown-yellow with a very small head. Nose is wood barnyard. Taste little sourness, wood, a bit dry finish. A great complex and balanced lambic. Great beer for an unblended lambic, Karel did the job again.

My Bottom Line :  
As authentic as they come, this Lambics funk and sourness develop citrusy fruitiness and wet haystacks alongside wheat flavors. 

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A ring of foam surrounds the hazy pale amber.
-Carbonation was quite mellow, which made the sourness feel more potent.
-Flavor definition was not as clear as I would have liked.
-If you are looking for some true Lambic funk, this one will still meet your expectations.

Bottle.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2013 750ml bottle. Pours golden, no head. A very gentle and subtle nose with some vinous notes, tart & funk. Taste is quite particular and not as outspoken as for example Cantillons Grand Cru Bruocsella. Nice aperitive.

------ with 0.2 because of the great ageing potential! Tasted this in the cellars of Chez Moeder Lambic Saint-Gilles (Thank you Jean!). Murky copper colour with no head; very funky taste but very complex at a time.

2009 bottle. Pours a dark yellow color with no head. Aroma is really funky with notes of dank cheese, barnyard, wet hay, vinegar, white wine, white grapes and green apple. The flavor is also really funky with barnyard, musty old flavors, vinegar, green apple, white grape, vinegar, white wine, barnyard, wet hay and some horseblanket. The body is light with a dry mouthfeel. Overall a really nice super funky Lambic!
Bottle thanks rciesla. Orange hazy pour with white head. Brett, funky aroma, with citrus and light floral tones. Light tart flavor but still paletable. Nice lambic.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2016 750ml bottle (Pikkulintu, Helsinki) Shared with Jukka Ilmonen - many thanks!
Hazy mid orange. Classic dry lambic. Up front its apricot, then its resiny and woody, some orange too. Almost perfect lambic. Finishing the bottle is a sad event, as you want more.
750ml bottle - thanks Raskolnikov! (7:4:8:4:15=3.8)
Beautifully tart aroma, bit of wood and apricot. Lovely fruity body, but still magically crisp and tart. Damn, this is a classic geuze. Could do with just a little more tartness. Has a pleasant honey wheatiness in the finish - thats proof it needs to sour more! Thanks Rasmus!

Bottle shared at 3 Floyds in line for the event.  Im not sure who it was, but a big thank you is in order.  I believe it was the 2000 vintage.  Cloudy dark yellow pour with a faint head.  I noticed some autolysis (brunt rubber) in the nose.  However, none present in the taste which was tart citrus, barnyard, funk, and wood notes.  It might have been just a bit passed its prime..

Bottle. Bottled 2005. Pours a bright and clear amber body with a great frothy off-white head that retained as a thin covering despite the minimal carbonation. The nose is super funky and woody with a little bit of acetic acid. Just a light bit of cheesiness, and a little cereal grain. Tbe flavor is pretty well spot on with the other straight Lambics that Ive had. Big funk and woodiness with just a light hint of acidity, making it very drinkable. Bone dry and refreshing with just a touch of carbonation. Makes me more thirsty with each sip. Excellent beer, just wish it were more available and a little cheaper.

Bottle pulled out by DrBill, big thanks! Pour was hazy straw yellow with white head, aroma blasted you with notes of cheese, horseblanket, lemony tartness, some dirty socks, all of the awesome funk notes, some slight hints of biscuity bread and spice in there.  Taste is all tart and funk, with big horseblanket, barnyard, cheese notes balanced by a wave of tart lemon, lactic notes with some slight biscuit to restrain it, finishing tart, dry.  World class stuff, need to seek out the rest of this brewerys brews.

Bottle shared by an unknown kins soul at the stlhops Funk fest.  Pour is slightly cloudy golden color with a large white head.  Aroma is funk, barnyard, hay, light cereal malt, and a smooth slightly sweet note.  Flavor is so smooth with notes of funk, old socks, horse-back, and notes of hay.  Really well rounded and smooth.

@ Modeste bierfestival , Antwerpen 
Head: none 
Colour: gold, clear 
Smell: more geuzey than the jonge lambiek, bit bitterder too, green apples bit of apricot 
Taste: malty, sour, bit of vegtables, slightly more bitter , end is semi dry and grassy , good !

750 ml 2000 vintage. Picked up at In de Verzekering tegen de Grote Dorst (thanks to Kurt Paneels for recommending) and shared with buds at Jason tasting. Hazy orange pour with only a thin white head that faded quickly. Nice floral aroma, with notes of lemon zest, straw and oak. 750 ml corked and caged bottle poured a clear tarnished gold with no head. Aromas of grassiness, horsblanket, rubber, leather, pepper and light citrus. 75cl bottle at Delirium Cafe Brussels vintage 2000. I could smell this one as the barman poured it into our De Cam glasses. This was a great beer to start me and oj83s epic lambic trip! Apparently the last bottle Delirium had in the cellar. There was some carbonation to this but it was hardly a geuze. Great complexity of flavours considering its an unblended beer.
